Signed In Enable Smart Lock\'s credential selector Enable Smart Lock\'s hint selector Sign In An unknown error occurred Firebase + Google Sign In Use a Google Sign In credential to authenticate with Firebase. Default theme Firebase + Facebook Login Use a Facebook Login credential to authenticate with Firebase.
Firebase + Twitter Login Use a Twitter Login credential to authenticate with Firebase.
Email/Password Authentication Use an email and password to authenticate with Firebase.
Phone Number Authentication Use a phone number to authenticate with Firebase.
Anonymous Authentication Sign in anonymously and then later upgrade to a full Firebase Auth user.
Custom Authentication Use a custom token signed by your own server to authenticate with Firebase.
FirebaseUI Auth Use the FirebaseUI-Android library to authenticate with Firebase.

Plaid is a source of design news & inspiration that serves as a concrete example of [material design principles](https://www.google.com/design/spec/material-design/introduction.html#introduction-principles). Plaid pulls data from [Designer News](https://www.designernews.co/), [Dribbble](https://dribbble.com/) & [Product Hunt](https://www.producthunt.com/); it is in no way an official client for these services nor endorsed by them. It is rather good though. Plaid is written by Nick Butcher [Twitter](http://twitter.com/crafty) | [Google+](http://google.com/+NickButcher) The source code is available on [GitHub](http://github.com/nickbutcher/plaid) "Plaid\'s icon is lovingly crafted by the inimitable Roman Nurik" [Twitter](http://twitter.com/romannurik) | [Google+](http://google.com/+RomanNurik) Plaid is built with the help of these awesome libraries website

Overview Sample App Features User Sign-in Let your users sign in with public identity providers or your own identity system. Whether your users sign in or not, the User sign-in feature configures Amazon Cognito to uniquely identify the user and provide your app the appropriate credentials to access your AWS resources. The Sample App demonstrates assignment of a unique identifier for the user, the Amazon Cognito User ID. If optional or mandatory User Sign-in has been enabled in your project, then the Sample App also includes a sign-in screen, with a button for each configured sign-in provider. Powered by Amazon Cognito Demo User Identity User Data Storage Store files for your users in the cloud.\nStore and sync user data in key/value pairs. Store user files such as photos in the cloud. Save user data in key/value pairs and sync across devices that are signed-in with the same user. The Sample App demonstrates User File Storage and User Profile Data. The User File Storage demonstration includes a remote file explorer, which allows you to upload and download files from your Amazon S3 bucket. You will have access to two folders, a public folder where files are accessible to all users and a private folder where files are only accessible by the current app user.\n\nThe User Profile Data demonstration stores an app color theme using Amazon Cognito Sync and synchronizes that data across all of the user\'s devices as key/value pairs. Powered by Amazon Cognito and Amazon S3 Demo User File Storage Demo User Profile Data Choose Image Downloaded image Allow account creation if email does not exist.
User Identity Keep track of users Displays the user identity. Open Open Remote URL Download Download Latest Version Pin Download & Pin Unpin Delete Local Copy Please wait … Loading local content Loading S3 objects list Failure Listing Content Transfer Failure Content Removal Error Permission Failure Denial of Read External Storage Permission has disabled the ability to upload user files. User Files Store and access files for your users. PUBLIC PRIVATE Private user file storage is only available to users who are signed-in. Sign-in is not turned on in the app. Upload New Folder Delete Remote File New folder Creating folder \'%s\' Deleting \'%s\' Uploading file \'%s\' Downloading item \'%s\' Failed to create folder due to \'%s\'. Failed to delete item due to \'%s\'. Failed to download item due to \'%s\'. Failed to upload file due to \'%s\'. User Profile Data Please wait … Loading… Please choose a theme: NoSQL Database Store data in the cloud. Store data in the cloud. The Sample App demonstrates how to access your configured Amazon DynamoDB NoSQL database tables. Select your table, insert sample data, and perform queries by choosing from a list of examples. Hold down an item in query results to update or delete the item. When you\'re done with the demo, you can remove the sample data from your table. Powered by Amazon DynamoDB

Query by Partition Key, Sort Condition, and Filter Find all items with %1$s = \'%2$s\', %3$s < \'%4$s\', and %5$s > \'%6$s\'.

This is a persistent Bottom Sheet You can show the rest of this sheet by sliding up. As you can see this is the extra content that you can show to the users after sliding this bottom sheet. This is an example activity to test bottom sheets which is added to the Android Support Library at v23.2.0 There are two types of bottom sheets:\n\nPersistent bottom sheets: it is always shown as you can see it below.\n\nModal bottom sheets: it is alternative to menus or simple dialogs. You can test it by clicking the button below. Show Bottom Sheet Modal
Upload Copy Print
\nWe aim to provide customers with eco-friendly services through the use of nature cleaning product and to ensure that that the quality of human life and our environment endures for future generations.\n\nWe encourage people who are allergic to harsh cleaning products, people with chronic illness, sensitive skin and asthma to join our go green team.
